question.text: Which of the following are not characteristic features of Fabaceae?

options.text: Tap root system, compound leaves and raceme inflorescence
Flowers actinomorphic, twisted aestivation and gamopetalous
Stamens ten, introrse, basifixed and dithecous
Monocarpellary, ovary superior and bent stigma

solution.text: Fabaceae or leguminosae are the third largest family of angiosperms. The main characters of this family are polypetalous condition, single carpel (monocarpellary condition), perigynous condition and marginal placentation, tap root system, simple or compound leaves, racemose, inflorescence, zygomorphic flowers, imbricate aestivation, stamens 10, introrse and fruit is legume or pod.
